data.title: Undercover Richard Jefferson teams with FBI to find stolen $2M
data.meta_description:
Richard Jefferson has dished 2,250 assists in his NBA career, but his most valuable one came off the court.
The former Net, alleging his former business manager...
data.text:
Richard Jefferson has dished 2,250 assists in his NBA career, but his most valuable one came off the court.

The former Net, alleging his former business manager had lifted $2 million from his bank credit line without Jefferson’s permission, reportedly aided the FBI in the investigation by placing a covert phone call to the alleged perpetrator and recording his confession.

According to TMZ Sports, after the current Mavericks forward reported his suspicions about Ted Kritza, Jefferson dialed up his former associate who, apparently no Stringer Bell, “confesses to wrong-doing.” That recorded evidence reportedly is now with the FBI.

The 34-year-old Jefferson played seven seasons with the then-New Jersey Nets, a mainstay on the run-and-gun teams anchored by Jason Kidd.

After leaving New Jersey following the 2007-08 campaign, he’s bounced around the league, offering a reliable veteran presence, a stout defender and apparently undercover expertise to Milwaukee, Sacramento, Golden State, Utah and now Dallas.
